overview: This subject provides a comprehensive overview of development in young people, focusing on the various factors that influence both healthy development and mental ill-health in childhood, adolescence and emerging adulthood. Subject content includes:

• The relationship between development and attachment and familial functioning
  • The influence of social, peer and intimate relationships on the lives of young people
  • Sexual development
  • Identity development
  • Cognitive and brain development
  • The impact of socio-cultural contexts on emerging adulthood
ilo: Describe contemporary, evidence-based theories relating to the development of young people.
Explain the relationship between developmental processes and the emergence of mental ill-health in young people
Articulate the impact of mental ill-health on developmental processes in young people
Describe the key processes occurring across the various developmental domains in young people
Explain the influence of the socio-cultural environment on emerging adulthood
generic_skills: Capacity to translate knowledge into practice

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Online Quizzes of learning content – two multiple choice quizzes with 10 questions each = 20 questions in total (1% per question)
Graded discussion board – posting fortnightly reflections on learning content and responding to fellow students, with a minimum of 7 posts in total

date_times.contact_hours: Online equivalent to 20 contact hours is made up of 10 hours of lectures and live consultation sessions, and 10 hours of asynchronous discussions and structured online tasks.
